JOINOURREVOLUTIONBewerben AboutAnexia bietet hochwertige und individuelle Lösungen im Bereich Web- und Managed Hosting, sowie Individualsoftware- und App Entwicklung. Das 2006 gegründete Unternehmen mit Sitz in Klagenfurt und weiteren Standorten in Wien, Graz, Karlsruhe, Nürnberg und New York betreut zahlreiche internationale Kunden. Über 350 Mitarbeiter:innen an mehr als 5 Bürostandorten in Österreich, Deutschland und den USA Wir sind ISO-zertifiziert und haben seit Jahren eine „Sehr gute Bonität". Auf diese Qualität vertrauen Kunden wie Lufthansa, McDonalds, TeamViewer, u.v.m. Du hast noch Fragen?Marina MAROS | Telefon: +43-50-556 | E-mail: career@anexia-it.com

7306198.title: Field Service Engineer Part Management (m/f/d)
7306198.description: IMS Nanofabrication GmbH is a high-tech Austrian company with headquarters in Brunn am Gebirge and further subsidiaries in Vienna, Taiwan, South Korea, and the USA. We are a leading global supplier in the field of semiconductor technology. With our mask writers, we contribute significantly to the global semiconductor industry and enable the production of state-of-the-art chips that are used in powerful cell phones, PCs and data centers. Field Service Engineer Part Management (m/f/d)This job revolves around the meticulous management of parts crucial for servicing and maintaining equipment. With a focus on efficiency and precision, this position plays a vital role in ensuring the smooth functioning of service operations and enhancing customer satisfaction. Your Responsibilities:Handling parts for Service: Responsible for creating and maintaining scalable Service parts demand and Service Bill of Materials (BOM) Point of contact in Service for PPC and Logistics teams. Communication, bookkeeping and coordination of parts demand for Service in branches for planned and non-planned maintenance. Managing shipments of Service parts to abroad storages for scheduled and non-scheduled maintenance Accountable for Service parts handling process optimization. Responsible for Service parts for upgrades (roll-out): Determining part needs for upgrades (roll-out impacted tools list). Scheduling exchanges in alignment with Key Account & local Service Manager. Management of outdated parts (use up, return, scrap). Support role in Service: Perform standard and nonstandard maintenance tasks and support PMs on the MBMW tools in Austria and at Customer sites upon need. Willingness to travel abroad to collaborate with local engineers. Your Qualification:At least 3 years of professional experience in the semiconductor or automotive industry or 3 years within IMS Technical education in the fields of electrical or mechanical engineering or similar Careful, detailed and structured working method Strong communication and social skills as well as extraordinary service orientation Good knowledge of vacuum systems, electronics and/or mechanics Programming knowledge (SPS, Python) and experience with Linux systems is advantageous Practical experience in engineering (mechanical or electrical) preferred We offer:We are a leading high-tech company with headquarters in Austria and international subsidiaries (Taiwan, Korea, USA) Excellent professional and personal development opportunities in an international company Very cooperative and motivated team with short communication channels Top-equipped workplace (modern office, laptop, height-adjustable desk, very good company restaurant) An attractive salary package that starts at an annual gross salary of 42.000,- EUR for this position and can be higher depending on experience (KV Metal industry). In addition, all employees benefit from the company's success with an IMS bonus program. Employees' voices Video Our ValuesReliability Innovation People Your BenefitsBeverages Fruits Events Development Health Buddy System Discounts Working Hours Cooperative Spirit IMS Restaurant E-Charger Free Parking Travel Cleanroom Further information about IMS Nanofabrication can be found at www.ims.co.at. Apply now   IMS Nanofabrication GmbH  Wolfholzgasse 20 - 24 | Brunn am Gebirge | Austria | +43 2236 37 310 | www.ims.co.at We write the future.

7342096.title: Devops Engineer (m/f/d)
7342096.description: Devops Engineer (m/f/d)at PlanRadar GmbH   Vienna Position  Full-time Location  Vienna Start  As of Now Contract  Permanent What we do at PlanRadarPlanRadar is a leading platform for digital documentation, communication and reporting in construction, facility management and real estate projects. It enables customers to work more efficiently, enhance quality and achieve full project transparency. By improving collaboration and providing access to real-time data, PlanRadar's easy-to-use platform adds value to every person involved in a building's lifecycle, with flexible capabilities for all company sizes and processes. Today, PlanRadar serves more than 150,000 users across 75+ countries.   PlanRadar promises an inclusive, engaging and exciting place to work. We are inquisitive minds who challenge the status quo, with a drive to change our client's industry for the better. Our people matter the most, and we regularly conduct surveys and implement changes to ensure our benefits and the way we work reflects the culture that we promote. If you're courageous and ready for a new adventure, join PlanRadar!   Meet the team here! What you'll get to doWe are looking to hire a Devops Engineer (m/f/d) to join our team working on our development and hosting infrastructure. Our Ruby on Rails based webapp/API is used worldwide by many companies from the construction and real estate business which brings unique challenges, especially around performance, security, and fast release cycles. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone craving ownership and eager to have a huge impact on a fast growing scale-up in the B2B SaaS space! AMONG OTHER THINGS YOU WILLCI/CD Pipeline Management: Develop, implement, and maintain robust CI/CD pipelines using GitLab to automate testing, build, and deployment processes. Containerization & Orchestration: Design and maintain containerized application deployments using Docker, and manage orchestration using Kubernetes. Cloud Infrastructure Management: Deploy and maintain scalable, reliable infrastructure on AWS. (Azure / GCP is a plus) Cloud Cost Management: Monitor and manage cloud expenditures to ensure cost efficiency, utilizing AWS Cost Explorer, CloudWatch, and other cost management tools. Application Architecture Design: Collaborate with development teams to design scalable and efficient web applications, with a deep understanding of web application architecture Application Support: Provide support for the deployment and ongoing maintenance of Rails applications, with a focus on performance tuning and troubleshooting. Documentation & Knowledge Sharing: Maintain clear documentation of infrastructure, processes, and best practices. Provide training and guidance to the development team as needed. Monitoring & Logging: Set up and manage monitoring solutions using Prometheus, Grafana, and other relevant tools to ensure high availability and performance. Security Best Practices: Implement and enforce security policies and ensure compliance with industry standards for cloud environments. Uptime: Implement high-availability (HA) architectures, disaster recovery plans, and failover strategies to ensure system uptime. WHO YOU ARE3+ years of experience in DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), or a related role. Proven expertise in GitLab CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment strategies. Hands-on experience with Docker and managing containerized applications. Proficiency in Kubernetes for orchestrating containerized services at scale. Solid understanding of cloud platform: AWS, (Azure / GCP is a plus). Strong scripting skills in Bash, Python, (Ruby is a plus). Experience in AWS Cost Management and optimization techniques, including rightsizing, reserved instances, and using Cost Explorer. Solid understanding of web application architecture, including frontend-backend interaction, API design, microservices, and cloud-based hosting. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. What we offerRoom for personal and professional development Challenging and diversified line of action Working in a fast-growing company with international customers and investors Centrally located and attractive office in one of our locations worldwide Possibilities to work from home Performance-related career system Motivated and agile team with a common vision Additional benefits like team events, free drinks & snacks, … Buddy program In-house trainings Global culture Relocation package Team events Home Office possibilities Flexible working hours Free drinks, snacks & fruits Referral program Commission or bonus Your SalaryThe annual gross salary for this position based on a full-time employment depending on your individual professional qualifications and previous experience ranges from EUR 52,500- to EUR 66,500.-. This includes: full health insurance, occupational accident insurance, public pension scheme and public unemployment insurance. Your recruiterNoushin Islam  Recruiterin "We build careers and shape futures, one perfect match at a time!" Apply now

7300003.title: Senior Technical Product Manager for IoT Connectivity  (m/f/d)
7300003.description: Senior Technical Product Manager for IoT Connectivity (m/f/d)Company Summary: A1 Digital makes digitalization happen. With scalable services and innovative solutions in the areas of IoT, cloud and security, we are the ideal partner for digital projects in medium-sized businesses. A1 Digital currently supports more than 500 companies in their digital transformation. Our experts at our locations in Vienna, Munich and Lausanne are already working with the technologies of tomorrow today. This is a path we can only take together - join in! Location: Vienna, Austria Purpose of the Role: As Senior Technical  Product Manager for IoT Connectivity you will be part of the Vertical Markets team and responsible for the solution lifecycle management of our Managed Connectivity Offering. This includes scope, development and management of solutions, as well as defining Roadmaps and incident handling. The Product Manager will be working in a small team with flat hierarchies and closely interlinked to our team of consultants, solution architects, platform engineers and service delivery teams to create solutions and services that keep us at the leading edge of technology and ahead of the competition. Key Responsibilities: Develop and continuously improve our propositions for our IoT Connectivity Solution based on in-depth market and technology analysis: Market Analysis and Trends: Analyze market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscapes to define the product strategy. Product Roadmap: Develop and maintain a product roadmap that aligns with market demands and the company's strategy. Product Requirements: Create detailed requirements and specifications for new products or enhancements to existing products. Architecture and Design: Collaborate with technical teams to define the architecture and design of IoT connectivity solutions. Technical Support: Provide technical support to development teams, especially when integrating new technologies or platforms. Technology Evaluation: Assess new technologies, networks (e.g., 5G, LPWAN), and platforms relevant to IoT applications. Project Management: Lead and coordinate product development projects, including scheduling, resource allocation, and progress tracking. Stakeholder Management: Work with internal and external stakeholders, including customers, sales, marketing, engineering, and support. Quality Assurance: Ensure products meet quality standards and regulatory requirements. Market Launch: Plan and execute go-to-market strategies, including pricing, positioning, and sales support. Customer Support and Feedback: Support sales and customer service to address technical queries and incorporate customer feedback into future product developments. KPI Tracking: Monitor product performance using Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) such as revenue, market share, customer satisfaction, and service quality. Data Analysis: Use data analytics to understand usage patterns and identify areas for improvement. Security Requirements: Ensure connectivity solutions meet security standards and mitigate potential threats. Regulatory Compliance: Ensure compliance with industry regulations and data protection laws, particularly in regulated markets. Innovation Pipeline: Build and maintain an innovation pipeline to explore new business opportunities through IoT connectivity. Partnerships: Identify and manage partnerships with technology providers, platforms, and other relevant players in the IoT ecosystem. Required Skills and Experience: Relevant university degree (or adequate professional experience) - technical background At least 5 years of professional experience in product management, preferably within Connectivity/ Telecommunication Area Proven track record in product management and understanding of technology in M2M/IoT Connectivity Ability to abstract complex technical and commercial information and transform these into easy-to-understand propositions for sales and customers Broad interdisciplinary know-how on business topics and market understanding - preferable in one or many of our focus industries (transportation, utilities, construction, waste, manufacturing, retail) Fluency in English and German is required Personal Attributes: Market oriented and analytical, structured approach to creating customer value from emerging technologies Possess the ability to think in value propositions and to analyse and design multi-sided business models Eagerness and curiosity to develop new business models based on platform economies and ecosystems Ability to understand and mediate between customer needs and engineering capabilities What we offer: Flexible working hours, mobile working. Autonomous working conditions with a lot of freedom to create. Modern working atmosphere and centrally located office with great public transport connection. Constant learning with many possibilities and offers. Paid lunch break and cantina, extra holidays, employee rates and many further discounts. Team events as well as trainings and further education There are many possibilities to develop in our company! Seize the chance, evolve and use the possibility to make your career! We are looking forward to your application! Our performance-based-salary models reward extraordinary commitment and success. The minimum annual gross salary according to the collective agreement of Telekom Austria AG is EUR 55.481,02 The actual annual salary depends on your skills and experience. We at A1 are convinced that women with their ideas and way to work are indispensable for the success of our company and culture. We are therefore pleased about the interest of women in the advertised position and especially invite women to apply.  Unser Mindset Wir bei A1 wollen mit den Besten zusammenarbeiten und glauben, dass Talent keine Norm hat.  Wir nehmen Menschen mit auf unsere Reise, von denen wir lernen können und die uns täglich inspirieren, die Zukunft digitaler, nachhaltiger und inklusiver zu gestalten. 7354309.title: Internship in the field of “Integrated Energy Systems” (With the possibility of writing a Final Thesis)
7354309.description: As Austria's largest research and technology organisation for applied research, we have set ourselves the goal of making substantial contributions to solving the major challenges of our time, climate change and digitalisation. To achieve our goals, we rely on our specific research, development and technology competencies, which are the basis of our commitment to excellence in all areas. With our open culture of innovation and our motivated, international teams, we are working to position AIT as Austria's leading research institution at the highest international level and to make a positive contribution to the economy and society. Our Center for Energy located in Vienna invites applications for an internship. Our experts from the Competence Unit  Integrated Energy Systems research the generation and integration of renewable energy sources and storage into the existing energy markets, as well as the decarbonisation of district heating, industrial processes, mobility as well as by supporting greening the gas. The transformation and digotalisation of the energy system requires not only technological solutions, but above all the interaction of technical possibilities with the energy markets. Internship in the field of "Integrated Energy Systems" (With the possibility of writing a Final Thesis)CENTER FOR ENERGYThroughout this internship you will get to know our interdisciplinary team of research engineers and scientists and have the chance to actively contribute on achieving climate goals for a sustainable future. Under the guidance of our team, you will gain insights into our national and international research projects conducted in cooperation with innovative partners and start-ups in the Energy sector or in collaboration with heat & electricity suppliers and grid operators. Depending on your study programme you will be able to choose from a wide range of tasks, that contribute to our scientific work, such as: programming activities support in the conception and development of simulation and optimisation models in the area of decarbonisation of industry, heat or the market integration of storage systems and flexible components. statistical analysis of measurement data using modern modelling and simulation tools. graphical preparation of the obtained results, ensuring that they can be scientifically used for projects reports. You will bring your own ideas and contributions and will further develop your practical skills in programming languages. You will gain a detailed insight into current issues in energy research and deepen your knowledge by exchanging views and ideas with our team of experts. You will get in contact with other interns from different thematic competence units and build up connections for your professional future. Optional: You have the opportunity to work on your final thesis within a knowledgeable and supportive team. Your qualifications as an Ingenious Partner: You are studying in the field of Energy Systems, Renewable Energy Systems, Energy Economics, Mathematics, Physics, Informatics, Mechanical, Electrical or Process Engineering, or similar You are enrolled at an Austrian university for the duration of the internship, and have completed at least 3 semesters of studies Programming capabilities (such as Python, R, Julia) are beneficial Interest and knowledge in the development of mathematical algorithms Good knowledge in one of the following: electricity, gas and heat system/markets Interest in the new and innovative topics in the field of energy economics Interest to work in a multidisciplinary team and collaborate on different topics Good verbal and written English and/or German skills What to expect: Duration of the internship: 4-6 months, starting April 2025 earliest A remuneration of at least EUR 1.366,-- gross per month for 38.5 hours per week. In addition to our company benefits, we offer flexible working conditions and work experience in a highly innovative environment. As a research institution, we are familiar with the supervision and implementation of final theses. In case you are interested in writing your bachelor's or master's thesis throughout this internship, please let us know. We are looking forward to supporting you accordingly. AIT participates in the Internship for Female Students programme of the Austrian Research Promotion Agency. At AIT diversity and inclusion are of great importance. This is why we strive to inspire women to join our teams in the field of technology. Please submit your application documents including your CV and cover letter online:Apply now! Tomorrow Today - with You?

7107394.title: Power2X I&C Engineer (m/f/d)
7107394.description: Power2X I&C Engineer (m/f/d) - ID 12253en_USVienna, Vienna, AT Are you ready to make a global impact in the fight against climate change? ANDRITZ is seeking a dynamic I&C Engineer to support us with our Power-to-X projects. In this role you will be responsible to define, specify and clarify instrument and control requirments for our green hydrogen and renewable fuel solutions. We are looking for a professional with wealthy experience in process control engineering. Your deep understanding of defining requirements and designing control solutions will play a crucial role for the success of our projects. Join ANDRITZ's Power-2X-enterprise, where our mission is crystal clear: to lead in reducing CO2 emissions through innovative green hydrogen and renewable fuel plant solutions. What sets us apart? Our passionate team of engineers and a rich history of global EPC projects, combined with our leadership in technology and manufacturing. Be part of a world class dynamic team enabling to grow the green hydrogen and Power2X economy with the opportunity to take over a higher management repsonbility in the future. We are enriched by our multicultural and multinational team, and we continuously foster flat hierarchies and an open dialog culture. If you're enthusiastic about contributing to the profitable growth within this rapidly growing division, we can't wait to connect with you. In your role, you will Develop innovative control concepts for our plant solutions Define requirements for the automation, instrumentation and control equipment Participating HAZOP and LOPA studies Preparing of control flow charts and function descriptions for the software developing Align and jointly review the control interfaces to package units Be part of the commissioning, start-up, and optimization team Manage and define related template and standard specifications Clarify technical solutions, collect all required data and review all deliverables Optimize system solutions according to our requirements with the suppliers Take the responsibility to coordinate with all stakeholders Clarify, discuss and present the technical solution towards the customer In your personal skillset you have  Degree level qualification in a process, automation or control engineering discipline is a plus. Minimum five years of experience as a I&C engineer or similar roll, experience within the process or petrochemical industry is a plus. Practical experience of plant commissioning is a must, knowledge to review and check PLC software is a plus. Ability to consult with customers and suppliers about technical design requirements is expected. Explain design solutions in an engaging manner Strong communication, analytical and planning skills Solution/team/customer oriented with the confidence to act pro-actively Fluent in English. Another European language is an advantage Willingness to travel for 3 days per month on average We also value Customer focused and open personality with ownership for performance and shared commitment. High-performance mindset with the capability to operate effectively under tight deadlines. Ability to communicate, cooperate and interact comfortably across cultures. Future oriented thinking and interest in continuous development. Ability to work well within a team and foster collaboration. Proactive, energetic approach to tasks, coupled with a positive mindset. What we offer Andritz AG offers a secure job in an innovative and international company with long-term development opportunities. To be part of a world class team enabling the growth of the P2X economy and therefore meeting key environmental targets To work in a multicultural environment which fosters a culture of continuous development and inclusivity To operate in a flat hierarchy, open for challenge and debate with the advantage of a start-up culture within a global well-established firm To benefit from a hybrid working environment To enjoy the advantage to grow alongside the business and become an expert in this field with a chance for a further career step alongside the growth of the business To enjoy first class industry or on the job training Further benefits to be discussed at offer stage In Austria we are legally obliged to announce at least a gross monthly salary of EUR 4.112,78 per month for this position.  Depending on qualifications and professional experience we offer you a market-based salary. Bitte bewerben Sie sich über unsere Website:   andritz.com/careers ENGINEERED SUCCESS

7357219.title: Finance Project/Technical Assistant to the Vice President Finance Continuous Improvement (m/f/x)
7357219.description: Jobnummer:  70142en_US Standort:  Vienna About usWe see a future where everyone can live and move without limitations. That's why we are developing technologies, systems and concepts that make vehicles safer and cleaner, while serving our communities, the planet and, above all, people. Forward. For all. Group SummaryMagna is more than one of the world's largest suppliers in the automotive space. We are a mobility technology company built to innovate, with a global, entrepreneurial-minded team. With 65+ years of expertise, our ecosystem of interconnected products combined with our complete vehicle expertise uniquely positions us to advance mobility in an expanded transportation landscape. Finance Project/Technical Assistant to the Vice President Finance Continuous Improvement (m/f/x)About the RoleWe are looking for a highly organized and proactive Finance Project/Technical Assistant to support the Vice President of Finance, Continuous Improvement in managing the Finance Transformation Portfolio - a comprehensive set of initiatives designed to modernize and streamline financial processes, improve data accuracy and visibility, and enhance decision-making across the enterprise. This role combines program management, project execution, and executive communications to oversee the Finance Transformation Portfolio. The ideal candidate will have a detail-oriented approach and a hands-on attitude, who can balance big-picture thinking with meticulous attention to project details. If you are a self-starter, thrive in a collaborative environment, and are motivated to make a difference in a high-visibility role, we'd love to meet you. Your ResponsibilitiesSupport the VP Finance, Continuous Improvement Assist the VP Finance in operational tasks, collaborating with various Functional Departments such as Magna IT, HR, Finance and Magna Groups and Divisions. Prepare management presentations in English, tailored for executive audiences. Project Management Monitor and report on project progress, proactively identifying and mitigating risks to ensure successful outcomes. Monitor and track project milestones, risks, and key deliverables. Support the development and maintenance of reporting dashboards to provide the VP Finance and executive stakeholders with up-to-date insights on project progress and outcomes. Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, IT, and Operations, to ensure seamless program execution. Stakeholder Coordination Support the engagement of stakeholders at all levels to foster a positive change environment. Facilitate communications with project sponsors, steering committees, and executive stakeholders to align expectations and address any concerns. Organize and manage meetings, prepare agendas, and ensure effective follow-up on action items. Who we are looking forUniversity degree in Finance, Business Administration, IT or a related field. Minimum 5 years of working experience in Finance functions of large corporates or relevant experience in the consulting sector. Solid understanding of project management approaches, with experience working on cross-functional projects. Proficiency in project management tools, preferably Asana, and data visualization software (e.g. Power BI) is a plus. Strong skills in MS Office (PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint and MS Teams). Fluent in German and English (verbal and written). Your preferred qualificationsExcellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with experience preparing materials for executive audiences. Results-oriented team player with a positive attitude. Highly organized, proactive and passionate for learning. Flexible, adaptable team player with the ability to thrive in ambiguous situations. High self-motivation and commitment to continuous improvement. Integrity, reliability and discretion are a must. What we offerAt Magna, you can expect an engaging and dynamic environment where you can help to develop industry-leading automotive technologies. We invest in our employees, providing them with the support and resources they need to succeed. As a member of our global team, you can expect exciting, varied responsibilities as well as a wide range of development prospects. Because we believe that your career path should be as unique as you are. The minimum annual remuneration package for this position is a minimum of EUR 55.000,- with corresponding qualification. We offer attractive benefits (e.g. discretionary performance bonus, employee profit participation program, etc.) and a salary which is in line with market conditions depending on your skills and experience. We provide 2 days/week Homeoffice. Regular travel up to 15% of the time. Site BenefitsPossibilities for creativity and room for own ideas. Corporate culture defined by innovation, involvement, and teamwork. Long-term perspectives in an international company. Attractive framework conditions for further training. Profit participation in the company's success. Home office options and flexible working hours. Employee and Family Assistance Program (childcare, health promotion, leisure and sports activities, benefits in everyday life). Awareness. Unity. Empowerment.At Magna, we believe that a diverse workforce is critical to our success. That's why we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire on the basis of experience and qualifications, and in consideration of job requirements, regardless of, in particular, color, ancestry, religion, gender, origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability or gender identity. Magna takes the privacy of your personal information seriously. We discourage you from sending applications via email to comply with GDPR requirements and your local Data Privacy Law. Bewerben

7384396.title: Marketing Automation Manager (w/m/d)
7384396.description: Marketing • Wien • Hybrid Marketing Automation Manager (w/m/d)Optimiere unsere Marketingprozesse und steigere den Erfolg durch innovative Automatisierungslösungen!Jetzt bewerben Werde Teil der group.one - The One Group to win online! Seit der Gründung in 1919 hat sich Herold laufend weiterentwickelt und ist heute Teil der group.one, die zu einer der führenden Unternehmensgruppen in Europa im Bereich Domains, Websites, Cloud Servern, Digital Marketing Services und Software as a Service (SaaS) Ansatz gehört. Wir unterstützen unsere Kund:innen international durch unsere verschiedenen Brands und über 1.500 motivierte Mitarbeiter:innen in verschiedenen Bereichen, um online erfolgreich zu sein.   Komm auch du als "Marketing Automation Manager (m/w/d)" in die group.one und trage zum Erfolg unserer Unternehmen im DACH- Raum bei. Deine Aufgaben: Mit deinem Fachwissen und deiner Berufserfahrung trägst du maßgeblich dazu bei, unsere Marketing Prozesse zu automatisieren und in weiterer Folge Kund:innen für unsere Dienstleistungen zu gewinnen und nachhaltig an die group.one zu binden. Du bist in ein internationales Team eingebunden und setzt deine Ideen eigenständig sowie in Teamarbeit in die Praxis um. Implementierung und Optimierung: Du richtest Marketing-Automation-Workflows in Zoho CRM ein, pflegst sie kontinuierlich und entwickelst sie weiter, um die Effizienz bei der Lead-Verwaltung und -Qualifizierung zu maximieren. Integration und Vernetzung: Du sorgst dafür, dass Zoho CRM nahtlos mit anderen Tools und Plattformen wie E-Mail-Marketing, Landing-Pages, Kampagnen und Analytics integriert ist und reibungslos zusammenarbeitet. Lead Management: Du automatisierst Prozesse wie Lead-Scoring, Nurturing und Tracking, um die Effektivität unserer Marketing- und Vertriebsaktivitäten entscheidend zu steigern. Kampagnenmanagement: Du unterstützt bei der Planung und Umsetzung von vielseitigen Kampagnen - sei es E-Mail-Marketing, Retargeting oder Multichannel-Strategien - und stellst sicher, dass sie reibungslos laufen. Analyse und Reporting: Du erstellst präzise Berichte zu den Automationsprozessen, der Kampagnen-Performance und der Lead-Qualität, analysierst diese und leitest daraus konkrete Optimierungsmaßnahmen ab. Innovationen und Trends: Du behältst die neuesten Trends in der Marketing-Automation im Blick und bringst kreative Ansätze ein, um unsere Prozesse kontinuierlich zu verbessern. Du arbeitest an Projekten mit Experten aus verschiedensten Ländern und Fachbereichen mit. Die Kampagnen selbst werden für den DACH-Raum konzipiert - sehr gute Deutsch - und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind daher für diese Stelle erforderlich. Dein Profil: Berufserfahrung: Du hast mindestens 2-3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Marketing Automation, CRM-Management und Lead-Generierung. Technisches Know-how: Du kennst dich bestens mit Zoho CRM aus und hast Erfahrung mit anderen Marketing-Automation-Tools wie Zoho Campaigns, Pipedrive und Analytics oder ähnlichen Plattformen. Analytische Fähigkeiten: Du hast ein starkes Interesse an Datenanalyse und KPI-Tracking, um fundierte, datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Detailorientierung: Du hast ein Auge für Details und kannst komplexe Prozesse übersichtlich gestalten und behältst immer den Überblick. Teamplayer: Du arbeitest gerne mit verschiedenen Abteilungen zusammen - sei es Marketing, Vertrieb oder IT-Support - und liebst den Austausch. Branchen-Know-how: Erfahrung in der IT-Branche oder im Umgang mit B2B-Kunden ist ein Plus. Unser Angebot:  Weiterentwicklung: Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln und deine Expertise im Bereich Marketing Automation auszubauen Verantwortung übernehmen: Du gestaltest aktiv die Prozesse und Systeme, die unser Wachstum vorantreiben.  Innovative Umgebung: In einem dynamischen Team kannst du deine Ideen einbringen und neue Trends umsetzen.  Eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem Unternehmen mit Zukunftsperspektive und internationalem Hintergrund Ein kollegial-freundschaftliches Betriebsklima und Teamwork Modernes Bürogebäude am HBF Wien mit umfangreichen Verkehrsanbindungen und Parkmöglichkeiten. Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitvereinbarung) und Homeoffice-Möglichkeit an bis zu zwei Tagen die Wochen Individuelle Karrierechancen durch Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten Dein Wohl lieg uns am Herzen. Im Office Hub Vienna bieten wir zusätzlich an: Gestütztes Betriebsrestaurant Kostenlose Massagemöglichkeit Gratis Obst, Kaffee und Tee Betriebsarzt Weitere Infos zu Herold als Arbeitgeber findest du auf unserer Karriereseite! Gehalt: Für diese Position ist - mit entsprechender Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung - ein Bruttomonatsgehalt ab EUR 3.400,-- vorgesehen. Uns ist es egal ob du weiblich, männlich, divers bist, wo du herkommst, wie alt du bist, welche Hautfarbe du hast oder woran du glaubst. Für uns stehen gegenseitiger Respekt, die persönliche Wertschätzung sowie Spaß und Motivation an der Arbeit im Fokus. Entfalte dich - deine Persönlichkeit - denn bei uns stehst Du als Mensch und Teammitglied im Mittelpunkt. Wir wollen weiter wachsen - gerne mit dir. Deshalb freuen wir uns darauf dich kennen zu lernen!     Abteilung Marketing Standorte Wien Status Homeoffice/Vor Ort Hybrid Monatsgehalt 3.400 EUR Beschäftigungsverhältnis Vollzeit Start möglich ab: 01.01.2025 Karrierelevel Spezialist/Fachkraft Gehaltstext Für diese Position ist - mit entsprechender Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung - ein Bruttomonatsgehalt ab EUR 3.400,-- vorgesehen. Arbeitszeit Vollzeit __JB_ID__ ka-at-premium, herold Kontakt Angelika Mittendorfer Business Partner - People & Culture Jetzt bewerben

7391032.title: Enterprise Account Manager (w/m/d)
7391032.description: Enterprise Account Manager (w/m/d)Beschreibung der PositionArbeiten bei Schneider Electric: IMPACT starts with us: Damit Energie und Ressourcen optimal genutzt werden können, bieten wir unseren Kund:innen auf der ganzen Welt digitale Energie- und Automatisierungslösungen an. Das ist echte Teamarbeit und nur dank des Engagements all unserer großartigen Mitarbeitenden möglich. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir täglich an einer nachhaltigeren Zukunft - vielleicht auch schon bald zusammen mit Dir? Bewirb Dich noch heute und werde IMPACT Maker bei Schneider Electric!   Als Enterprise Account Manager:in für Österreich (w/m/d) werden neue Kundenprojekte entwickelt und passende Lösungen für die Kunden in deren zentralen und dezentralen IT-Infrastrukturkonzepten gefunden. Dabei stehst Du den Endkunden als ein kompetenter Sparringspartner zur Seite, um Ideen und Lösungen beispielsweise zur Modernisierung der IT-Infrastruktur zu erörtern, mit dem Ziel, ihr Business nachhaltiger und effizienter zu gestalten. Diese Rolle ist ein wichtiger Treiber in der Entwicklung von Projekten und erfordert enge Zusammenarbeit mit einem kleinen und agilen Team. Dabei wird auf das komplette Lösungsportfolio für IT-Infrastruktur zurückgegriffen. Dein IMPACT:Verantwortung für die Vergrößerung des Marktanteils von Schneider Electric Betreuung der Kunden in Zusammenarbeit mit Vertragspartnern Erstellung kundenspezifischer Angebote gemeinsam mit dem Partner- und Alliances-Netzwerk Beratung der Kunden und Berücksichtigung ihrer Bedürfnisse Ausbau der bestehenden Kundenbasis und Identifizierung weiterer Wachstumschancen Intensive Kundenkontakte und vielfältige Tätigkeiten vor Ort (z.B. Prozessabsicherung durch Data Center, Modernisierung der IT-Infrastruktur, SMB-Bereich mit Infrastruktur) Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Kolleg:innen aus anderen Geschäftsbereichen Schnittstelle zwischen externen Partnern und internen Kollegen/Spezialisten Erfahrung im Umgang mit Senior Stakeholders Interesse an Use Cases und Entwicklung von Geschäftsmöglichkeiten in neuen Segmenten Unser AngebotWir geben Dir die Freiheit, eigene Entscheidungen zu treffen und Verantwortung zu übernehmen Du profitierst von regelmäßigen Trainings und neuen Entwicklungsperspektiven Ein unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag bei einem der nachhaltigsten Unternehmen der Welt Unser attraktives Gehalt und unsere Sozialleistungen sprechen für sich Innovation: Wir arbeiten nicht nur am Puls der Zeit - wir gestalten ihn mit Dank flexiblem Arbeiten fällt die Vereinbarkeit von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf leicht Dein ProfilTechnisches oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium Erfahrung im Vertrieb von IT-Infrastruktur-Lösungen Kenntnisse über hybride Rechenzentren und IT-Infrastrukturen, einschließlich Edge Computing Zusammenarbeit mit Systemintegratoren Technische Expertise in Elektrotechnik und/oder Kühlungstechnik Gutes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis Interesse an der Gewinnung von Neukunden Consulting Skills zur Förderung des Kundeninteresses Offenheit und hohe Lernmotivation Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zur Kundenkommunikation Return to the home page Standort(e)  Austria   Kategorien  Vertrieb   Req ID  81927 Jetzt bewerben Curiosity, Inclusion, Teamwork:   Kein Mensch ist makellos und nicht alle Karrierewege verlaufen gleich. Wichtig ist, dass wir den Willen haben zu lernen und uns weiterzuentwickeln. Denn wir wissen, dass Karriere auch bedeutet, seine Stärken erst mal finden zu müssen. Bewirb Dich jetzt, selbst wenn Du (noch) nicht alle Voraussetzungen erfüllst. Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennen zu lernen! Dein nächster Schritt -bewerben natürlich!  Bitte lade Deinen Lebenslauf inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung unter Angabe der Job-ID 81927 hoch.  Ansprechpartner für diese Position ist Dominik Kalthof. Bei Fragen zum Bewerbungsverfahren nimm gern per LinkedIn Kontakt auf.   Hinweis: Schneider Electric akzeptiert keine unaufgefordert zugesandten Bewerbungsunterlagen von Personalvermittlern. Sollte Schneider Electric einen Kandidaten berücksichtigen, dessen Profil von Personalvermittlern ohne bestehende Rahmenvereinbarung übersandt wurde, können hierdurch keine Ansprüche gegen Schneider Electric geltend gemacht werden.  Erfahre mehr:  Über @schneiderelectric_karriere findest Du uns auf Instagram, um keine News zu verpassen.  Alles rund um Schneider Electric als Arbeitgeber findest Du hier: https://www.se.com/de/de/about-us/careers/overview.jsp Jetzt bewerben Add to my Job Cart Möchtest auch Du mit Deiner Karriere ein/e IMPACT-Maker/in sein?Wenn Du darüber nachdenkst, einem neuen Team beizutreten, ist die Kultur entscheidend. Bei Schneider Electric bilden unsere Werte und Verhaltensweisen die Grundlage für die Schaffung einer großartigen Kultur, die den Geschäftserfolg unterstützt. Wir glauben, dass unsere IMPACT-Werte - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - bei uns selbst beginnen.   IMPACT lädt Dich ein, Dich Schneider Electric anzuschließen und unsere Nachhaltigkeitsambitionen in die Tat umzusetzen, unabhängig von Deiner Rolle. Es ist eine Einladung, Deine Karriere mit dem Ziel zu verbinden, eine widerstandsfähigere, effizientere und nachhaltigere Welt zu schaffen.   Wir sind auf der Suche nach IMPACT-Maker/innen - außergewöhnlichen Menschen, die Nachhaltigkeitsambitionen an der Schnittstelle von Automatisierung, Elektrifizierung und Digitalisierung in die Tat umsetzen. Wir feiern IMPACT-Maker/innen und glauben, dass jede/r das Potenzial dazu hat.   Werde ein/e IMPACT-Maker/in bei Schneider Electric - Bewirb Dich noch heute! 36 Mrd. EUR Umsatz weltweit  +13% organisches Wachstum  150 000+ Mitarbeiter in 100+ Ländern  #Platz 1 der Global 100 der nachhaltigsten Unternehmen der Welt Du musst Dich online bewerben, um für eine Stelle bei uns berücksichtigt zu werden. Diese Position bleibt, bis sie besetzt wurde, online.   Schneider Electric strebt danach, das inklusivste und fürsorglichste Unternehmen der Welt zu sein, indem wir allen Menschen überall die gleichen Chancen bieten und sicherstellen, dass sich alle Mitarbeitende in einzigartiger Weise wertgeschätzt und sicher fühlen, um ihr Bestes zu geben. Wir spiegeln die Diversität der Gesellschaften wider, in denen wir tätig sind, und "Inklusion" ist einer unserer Grundwerte. Wir sind davon überzeugt, dass unsere Unterschiede uns als Unternehmen und als Individuen stärken, und wir verpflichten uns, bei allem, was wir tun, für Inklusion einzutreten. Dies gilt auch für unserer Bewerberinnen und Bewerber und ist in unseren Einstellungsgrundlagen verankert.   Weitere Informationen über unser Engagement für Vielfalt, Gleichberechtigung und Integration finden Sie hier und unsere DEI-Richtlinie hier   Bei Schneider Electric halten wir die höchsten Standards in Bezug auf Ethik und Compliance aufrecht, und wir glauben, dass Vertrauen ein grundlegender Wert ist. Unsere Trust Charter ist unser Verhaltenscodex und zeigt unser Engagement für Ethik, Sicherheit, Nachhaltigkeit, Qualität und Cybersicherheit. Sie untermauert jeden Aspekt unseres Geschäfts und unsere Bereitschaft, uns gegenüber allen unseren Stakeholdern respektvoll und aufrichtig zu verhalten und zu handeln. Mehr über unsere Trust Charter erfährst Du hier   Schneider Electric ist ein Arbeitgeber, der die Chancengleichheit fördert. Es gehört zu unseren Grundsätzen, allen qualifizierten Personen ungeachtet von Rasse, Religion, Hautfarbe, Geschlecht, Behinderung, nationaler Herkunft, Abstammung, Alter, militärischen Status, sexueller Orientierung, Familienstand oder anderen rechtlich geschützten Merkmalen oder Verhaltensweisen die gleichen Beschäftigungs- und Aufstiegschancen zu bieten, und zwar in den Bereichen Rekrutierung, Schulung, Versetzung und Beförderung.ätzen, allen qualifizierten Personen ungeachtet ihrer Rasse, Religion, Hautfarbe, ihres Geschlechts, ihrer Behinderung, ihrer nationalen Herkunft, ihrer Abstammung, ihres Alters, ihres militärischen Status, ihrer sexuellen Orientierung, ihres Familienstands oder anderer rechtlich geschützter Merkmale oder Verhaltensweisen gleiche Beschäftigungs- und Aufstiegschancen zu bieten, und zwar in den Bereichen Rekrutierung, Einstellung, Schulung, Versetzung und Beförderung.

7347406.description: We are seeking a driven and ambitious individual to join our Supply Chain team in a key role focused on optimizing processes and working with data. The ideal candidate is not only technically proficient but also highly proactive, constantly striving to improve and find innovative solutions. This position offers the opportunity to grow your skills while making a tangible impact on supply chain efficiency. In der Position als …. An industry-standard, attractive and performance based annual gross salary starting at 57.700 Euro (on a full-time basis) with the possibility of higher pay according to experience and qualifications. 7371478.title: Datenanalyst/in
7371478.description: Integration in ÖsterreichDer Österreichische Integrationsfonds (ÖIF) ist an zehn Standorten sowie an mobilen Beratungsstellen in ganz Österreich aktiv. Wir unterstützen die Integration von Flüchtlingen und Zuwander/innen in Österreich durch Beratung, die Förderung von Deutschkenntnissen sowie Wertevermittlung. Zugleich informieren wir die Öffentlichkeit sachlich über Migration und Integration und fördern den Dialog zu Chancen und Herausforderungen des Zusammenlebens. Lernen Sie den ÖIF näher kennen auf: www.integrationsfonds.at. Fixed-Effekte-Modelle, Mehrebenenanalyse) von Vorteil Fundiertes Wissen zur Integrationslandschaft in Österreich Ausgezeichnete sprachliche Ausdrucksweise Wir bietenEine sinnstiftende Tätigkeit und die Möglichkeit im spannenden gesellschaftspolitischen Umfeld der Integration mitzuwirken Wir schätzen unser familiäres und diverses Arbeitsumfeld und leben die Du-Kultur ab dem ersten Tag Die Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie bzw. Beruf und Studium ist uns wichtig und wird gefördert (aktiv gelebte Gleitzeit, mitarbeiter/innenfreundliches Karenzmanagement, keine All-In Verträge) Wir bilden uns stetig weiter und bieten Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten (Weiterbildungskatalog, Mentoringprogramm, Nachwuchsführungskräfteprogramm) Die physische und mentale Gesundheit ist uns eine Herzensangelegenheit (betriebliche Gesundenuntersuchung, Teilnahme an sportlichen Aktivitäten, Supervision, kostenloser Obstkorb und Kaffee) Wir feiern gemeinsame Erfolge und vernetzen uns aktiv (umfassende Einschulung, jährlicher Teamtag, Mitarbeiter/innen-Events) Nachhaltigkeit und Umweltschutz werden von uns vorangetrieben (zentral gelegener Arbeitsplatz mit ausgezeichneter öffentlicher Anbindung, Förderung Klimaticket) Ein Bruttomonatsgehalt ab EUR 2.900,- je nach persönlichem Qualifikationsprofil und relevanter Berufserfahrung sowie Vergünstigungen bei Kooperationspartnern und ein Essenszuschuss Bewerben

7394380.title: Erfahrene:r Mitarbeiter:in für Geschäftsplanung, Datenanalyse und Kennzahlen im Flottenmanagement
7394380.description: Jetzt bewerben Erfahrene:r Mitarbeiter:in für Geschäftsplanung, Datenanalyse und Kennzahlen im FlottenmanagementÖBB-Personenverkehr AGWien-Favoriten, Wien, 1100, AUTNormalarbeitszeit Gleitzeit38,5 Std.req21202 Wir möchten neue Wege gehen. Und neue Wege schaffen. Heute. Für morgen. Für uns. Jetzt Teil des #TeamOEBB werden! Ihr Job Mitarbeit am internen Planungsprozess, Koordination von Planungsthemen als Schnittstelle zwischen der Personenverkehr AG und unserem Instandhaltungsunternehmen (ÖBB-Technische Services GmbH) sowie Kommunikation der Ergebnisse mit Instandhaltungsunternehmen und Stakeholder:innen. Strategisches und wirtschaftliches Denken gepaart mit Detailgenauigkeit, der Nutzung großer Datenmengen und sehr guten Excel- sowie Power-Pivot-Kenntnissen. Durchführung von Controllingtätigkeiten, Erarbeitung von Verbesserungsvorschlägen, Umsetzung von Gegenmaßnahmen sowie Erstellung und Überwachung von Geschäftsplänen, Budgets und Mittelfristplanungen zur Identifizierung von Kostenoptimierungspotenzialen. Entwicklung, Optimierung und Hinterfragung von Prozessen der Geschäfts- und Instandhaltungsplanung, Visualisierung und Kommunikation komplexer Datenmengen sowie Kontrolle von Qualitäts- und Leistungsvorgaben mittels Kennzahlen und Verbesserung der Berechnungslogik. Sicherstellung des Überblicks über flottenrelevante Reports, Kennzahlen und Investitionen (Bestandsfuhrpark und Neubeschaffungen) sowie Diskussion der technischen und wirtschaftlichen Anforderungen an Investitionsvorhaben bei Verhandlungen. Ihr Profil Ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium und mehrjährige Berufserfahrung oder Erfahrung in der Verkehrs- und Schienenfahrzeugbranche können Sie vorweisen. Sie haben Interesse daran, Arbeitsabläufe und Prozesse zu verstehen, zu verbessern, kritisch zu hinterfragen und zu verhandeln. Die Analyse von großen Datenmengen liegt Ihnen und nutzen dafür geeignete Werkzeuge (z.B. Excel, Power BI etc.). Hohe Kommunikationskompetenz sowie professionelles Auftreten zeichnen Sie aus. Gutes Durchsetzungsvermögen, ein sicheres Auftreten und eine analytische und konzeptionelle Denkweise sowie Organisationsgeschick kennzeichnen Sie. Unser Angebot Wir bieten Ihnen einen modernen Arbeitsplatz mit exzellenter öffentlicher Anbindung am „schönsten" Hauptbahnhof Österreichs (lt. VCÖ-Bahntest 2019). Unsere Mission: bessere Vereinbarkeit von Beruf & Privatleben für alle Mitarbeiter:innen des ÖBB-Konzerns. Daher bieten wir u.a. betriebsnahe Kindergärten in Wien sowie Kinderbetreuung in den Ferien oder an Fenstertagen. Wir ermöglichen flexible Freizeitgestaltung durch ein attraktives Gleitzeitmodell und die Möglichkeit nach Absprache Home-Office zu konsumieren. Die ÖBB sind Rückgrat des öffentlichen Verkehrs und bringen als Österreichs größtes Klimaschutzunternehmen im Mobilitäts- und Logistikbereich Menschen und Güter sicher und umweltbewusst an ihr Ziel. Besondere Konditionen bei Bahnreisen & in unseren Reisebüros, Ferienhäuser und Appartements in beliebten heimischen Urlaubsregionen, hausinternes Car-Sharing, bei verschiedensten Geschäften und Dienstleister:innen und Versorgung des persönlichen Wohls durch eine moderne in-house Kantine. Unser konzerninternes Wohnungsservice bietet bundesweit ÖBB-Mitarbeiter:innenwohnungen an.  Sie haben die Option, die Fahrbegünstigung in Anspruch zu nehmen und Österreich mit der ÖBB zu entdecken. So arbeiten Sie nicht nur an klimafreundlicher Mobilität, sondern können auch umweltfreundlich mit Ihrer Familie reisen. Die Gesundheit unserer Mitarbeiter:innen liegt uns am Herzen, daher bieten wir regelmäßig die Möglichkeit zur Gesundenuntersuchung. Auch Gesundheitstage und Impfaktionen stehen jährlich am Programm. Sie profitieren von hervorragenden Weiterbildungsangeboten sowie zahlreichen Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten innerhalb des Konzerns. Für die Funktion "Senior Spezialist:in Fuhrparkmanagement" ist (laut Kollektivvertrag Eisenbahnunternehmen) ein Mindestentgelt von EUR 53.696,16 brutto/Jahr vorgesehen. Je nach Qualifikation und Berufserfahrung ist eine Überzahlung möglich. Ihre Bewerbung Bitte bewerben Sie sich online. Als interne:r Bewerber:in fügen Sie bitte idealerweise auch Ihren SAP-Auszug hinzu. Wir laden Sie herzlich ein, bei Fragen oder für weitere Informationen unseren ÖBB Job Shop bei Wien Mitte zu besuchen. Unser Team steht Ihnen gerne persönlich zur Verfügung und unterstützt Sie vor Ort. Mehr Infos finden sie unter: ÖBB Job Shop» Job-Beratung in Wien Mitte The Mall - ÖBB Karriere (oebb.at) Frauen sind ein unverzichtbarer Teil unseres Erfolges und unserer Unternehmenskultur. Deshalb begrüßen wir besonders Bewerbungen von Frauen, die bei gleicher Qualifikation - unter Berücksichtigung der relevanten Rahmenumstände aller Bewerbungen - bevorzugt aufgenommen werden. Wir weisen darauf hin, dass im Zuge der Aufnahme die Beibringung einer Strafregisterbescheinigung erforderlich ist. Ansprechpartner:innen Bei fachlichen Fragen zu dieser Jobausschreibung wenden Sie sich bitte an Teri Huber, +43664/8217147.  Für allgemeine Fragen zum Bewerbungsprozess steht Ihnen unser ÖBB Recruiting Team unter 05 1778 97 77888 gerne zur Verfügung. Über das Unternehmen: Seit 1923 prägen wir als ÖBB die Mobilität in Österreich und tragen die Verantwortung für eine moderne Infrastruktur sowie für die Beförderung von Menschen und Gütern. Eine Karriere bei den ÖBB ist nicht nur vielfältig, sondern auch sinnstiftend: Als größtes Klimaschutzunternehmen im Mobilitätssektor bewegen wir ganz Österreich, treiben die österreichische Wirtschaft voran, fördern Innovation und sind ein verlässlicher, verantwortungsbewusster Arbeitgeber. Wir unterstützen unsere Mitarbeiter:innen bei ihrer beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung, setzen Maßnahmen für ihre Gesundheit und gemeinsam schaffen wir eine Unternehmenskultur, die von Wertschätzung und respektvoller Zusammenarbeit geprägt ist. 7351720.title: Manager Mass Spectrometry Facility
7351720.description: Manager Mass Spectrometry FacilityFull Time (40 h/w) Klosterneuburg near Vienna, Austria / Home Office possible EUR 85,000* gross/year (All-In) - permanent contract ISTA is growing. Grow with us!Institute of Science and Technology Austria (ISTA) is a constantly growing international institute for conducting world-class research in mathematics, computer science, life sciences & physical sciences. We strive to recruit passionate professionals from across the world over all fields who strive to support our goal of excellent research. Located within a beautiful campus on the outskirts of Vienna, we offer multiple opportunities for personal growth in a stable working environment. Get an insight! Your responsibilitiesThe Mass Spectrometry Service at ISTA offers an array of advanced methods that cover both biological and chemical applications. Our services include High Resolution Mass Spectrum (HRMS) analysis of complex peptide mixtures (Burker timsTOF HT), intact proteins and synthetic compounds, targeted metabolite quantitation (Thermo Q-Exactive HF, Waters Xevo G3), and GC-MS analysis (Agilent 7890, 8860). Furthermore, the service runs analytical (Waters Acquity APC, Waters Acquity H-class with SQD2) and preparative (Thermo Ultimate 3000) HPLCs. Equipped with state-of-the-art instruments, our facility is dedicated to providing high-quality data and aiding researchers from experiment design to results interpretation. Our mission is to support the local research community by delivering insightful and reliable analytical results. At ISTA's Mass Spectrometry facility, you'll play a pivotal role in overseeing and advancing our cutting-edge equipment park and the service portfolio. Your expertise and grasp of research methodologies will be essential for providing exceptional support to our scientists. Manage and oversee operations of the Mass Spectrometry Unit, ensuring efficient and high-quality service delivery. Lead and develop a team of currently 4 colleagues (experts & technicians). Collaborate closely with researchers, guiding them from experimental design through to data interpretation. Develop and implement strategies to optimize facility workflows and introduce new methodologies. Maintain and troubleshoot instrumentation; plan and execute regular maintenance schedules. Provide training and support to researchers and facility users on proper instrumentation usage and best practices. Manage budgets and resources; prepare service quotes and handle project billing. Keep updated with advancements in mass spectrometry technologies and methodologies, integrating relevant innovations into the facility. Promote the facility's capabilities to attract new research projects and foster collaborations. Your profileAdvanced degree in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, or a related field with significant experience in mass spectrometry and proteomics. Proven track record in managing a core facility or similar laboratory environment. Extensive hands-on experience with mass spectrometry instruments, particularly those listed in our portfolio. High level of understanding and proven working knowledge of data analysis tools and workflows, particularly in the field of proteomics. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and accuracy. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of working effectively with a diverse research community. Ability to lead and motivate a team, manage multiple tasks, and adhere to tight deadlines. Experience in project management and budgeting. Apply now Your benefitsEducation & training Cafeteria Childcare Free shuttle bus Multiple health offers Pension insurance ⁎ This position comes with possible overpayment depending on education, qualification and work experience. ISTA processes your personal data in accordance with the law. For more information, please refer to ww www.ista.ac.at/data-protection. Am Campus 1, 3400 Klosterneuburg, Austria  Tel.: +43 (0) 2243 9000-0 | www.ista.ac.at

7374187.title: Customer Insights Manager for EUCAN (m/f/d)
7374187.description: Our CompanyAt Boehringer Ingelheim we develop breakthrough therapies and innovative healthcare solutions in areas of unmet medical need for both humans and animals. As a family owned company, we focus on long-term performance. We believe that, if we have talented and ambitious people who are passionate about innovation, there is no limit to what we can achieve; after all, we started with just 28 people. Now, we are powered by 50,000 employees globally who nurture a diverse, collaborative and inclusive culture. Customer Insights Manager for EUCAN (m/f/d)Wien JOB-ID:17771 The positionBecome a part of our established EUCAN (Europe and Canada) Center of Excellence for Understanding Market & Competition in Vienna! We are searching for a Customer Insights Manager, who will be responsible for collecting and analyzing insights to steer the Boehringer Ingelheim business. Tasks & responsibilitiesAnticipate and Define Business Questions: Identify and address key business questions related to commercial success, offering tailored solutions to enhance business outcomes. Customer Insight Collection: Develop and implement strategies to gather customer insights across diverse groups (e.g., HCPs, patients, payors) within various therapeutic areas for current and future portfolios. Data Analysis for Customer Understanding: Investigate opportunities to integrate and analyze data from various market research sources, delivering holistic insights into customer behavior for enhanced customer experiences. Forecasting Process Leadership: Drive the forecasting process in collaboration with global, regional and country teams, employing methodologies such as patient-based and trend-based forecasting to inform business planning. Project Setup and Strategic Collaboration: Establish projects and processes with country teams to ensure timely collection and delivery of insights that meet business partner expectations; act as a strategic partner to brand teams across the EUCAN region, understanding brand strategy and potential value for both in-line and pipeline assets. RequirementsBachelor's level degree or higher with a strong academic understanding in fields such as Marketing, Economics, Life Sciences, Health Sciences (e.g., Pharmacy, Medicine, Biology) is required. 7+ years of professional experience, with a minimum of 3-5 years in Market Research in the Pharmaceutical or Health Care industry. Highly skilled in the use of relevant tools for primary (qualitative and quantitative) market research, data capturing, and analysis. Skilled and experienced in forecasting procedures and methodologies (e.g., patient-based forecasting, trend-based forecasting, other forecasting methodologies). Additional experience in Business Analysis or related areas in the Pharmaceutical industry is regarded as a plus. Excellent strategic thinking skills with a demonstrated ability to identify business issues/opportunities, frame business questions, contextualize the answers, and quantify market events/business decisions. Highly skilled in project management and budget management with excellent prioritization and stakeholder management skills. Excellent communication skills with fluency in oral and written English being a must; German would be a plus, and any additional languages are an asset. Your BenefitsFlexible working time models/home office depending on the position Additional off-days (bridge-days) for more leisure time Staff restaurant with a variety of lunch options for your daily well-being Position specific training opportunities for your personal and professional growth Comprehensive health promotion, sustaining your health in the best possible way The minimum gross annual salary according to the collective bargaining agreement for this position is EUR 58.199,96 (full time). For the actual salary the industry benchmark as well as your qualifications and experiences are taken into consideration. We are looking forward to receiving your application online!By uploading your application documents via our application portal, we can treat your data confidentially and in compliance with the GDPR.  Do you have any additional questions about the position? Your HR Recruiting Manager for this position is Katrin Spögler. On our career site you will find further information about us as an employer as well as information about the application process or our diverse divisions. Take a look behind the scenes and get an insight into our day-to-day business. Jetzt bewerben

In addition, all employees benefit from the company's success with an IMS bonus program. 7360840.description: HUAWEI is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices; with integrated solutions across four key domains - Telecom Networks, IT, Smart devices, and Cloud Services. 7293925.title: Junior IT Manager (Application Support Engineer)
7293925.description: Junior IT Manager (Application Support Engineer)RailNetEurope (RNE) is an association of European Infrastructure Managers (IMs) and Allocation Bodies (ABs) with the common goal of facilitating international traffic on the European rail infrastructure and increasing the efficiency of the IMs'/ABs' processes. RNE's Joint Office (JO) is located in Vienna with approximately 70 employees from many different European countries.   Detailed information can be found on RNE's website: www.rne.eu   We are looking for a dedicated and skilled Junior IT Manager to join our team and play a crucial role in supporting the Train Information System (TIS). TIS is a web-based application essential for international train management, providing real-time data on both international and national passenger and freight trains, sourced directly from Infrastructure Managers' systems. Your duties / responsibilitiesProvide first and second-line support for the TIS application, troubleshooting and resolving technical issues reported by users. Ensure effective functionality of both front-end and back-end components of applications. Conduct root cause analysis for data errors and escalate significant issues to management. Maintain records of configuration changes and schedule application updates. Provide feedback to the development team based on the analysis and user experiences to promote continuous improvement and innovation within the application. Collaborate with RNE members and other stakeholders to ensure data integrity and seamless integration with their systems. Maintain and update technical documents and procedures. Prepare maintenance plans and upgrade schedules for applications. Implement configuration changes to test and production environments. Organise and prepare for meetings and events, including drafting agendas and minutes. Advocate for broader adoption of TIS within the European Railway Network, focusing on enhancing interoperability. Your qualifications & skillsBachelor's degree in the field of computer and IT systems, with at least 1 year of experience, or a non-academic educational background with a minimum of 3 years' experience in similar roles Proficiency in managing migrations, configurations, document changes, and monitor application performance. Strong SQL scripting skills and experience with XML data processing. Exceptional analytical and troubleshooting abilities. Strong organisational skills with the ability to prioritise tasks effectively. Experience managing expectations, handling change request and resolving technical issues. Detail-oriented with high standards for quality and accuracy, a self-motivated, goal-oriented personality. Proficiency in business English (written and spoken), additional languages are desirable. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to simplify complex technical concepts. Strong interpersonal skills, capable of building and maintaining relationships with users and stakeholders. ITIL certification is a significant advantage. Knowledge of the railway infrastructure sector and the operation processes will be considered a plus. What we offerThe annual gross minimum wage for this position according to the Austrian Act on Equal treatment is EUR 45.000, - (full time - 40h/week), with willingness to negotiate overpayments in line with the market, depending on experience and qualifications. Up to 50% home office to maintain a good balance between work and leisure time A brand new modern and fully accessible office A friendly and cooperative team with interesting projects Individual development opportunities in an international company Company mobile phone of your choice with possibility of private usage Lunch deal with our neighbouring restaurant, Quartier Sechs Your benefitsattractive salary up to 50% home office modern working environment mobile phone of choice for private use lunch deal at Quartier Sechs working in a sustainable industry Are you interested in the position?Please, send your CV together with a letter of motivation (including possible starting date and salary expectations) to Mr. Nektarios Zacharias. ContactPersonMr Nektarios Zacharias  Team Leader TIS  +43 664 884 248 13  smart bewerben GDPR note:   Your job application requires submission of personal information to RNE. According to our internal rules, the RNE Managing Board shall appoint the staff of the Joint Office in Vienna. As an association of more than 30 companies around Europe, RNE members provide their funding and are involved in its operations. With this said we inform all job applicants about the above particularities. Therefore, RNE human resources personnel (or HR agency on its behalf) and RNE management considering your application and RNE members will have access to your personal information included in your CV.  This is our way to find a balance between transparency in our organisation and your privacy. Thus, the applicants are explicitly asked to consent to this and with the submission of your job application, we consider you agree and give explicit consent on the above distributions of your CV to the RNE Managing Board members and the GA representatives.  In other words, by submitting your application, you consent to the processing of your personal data in the above way, and if hired, to the ongoing processing of your personal data for administrative purposes in connection with your employment.

At RHI Magnesita we appreciate the value of diverse teams. We kindly ask you to submit your application online and in English. Due to data privacy reasons, applications via e-mail cannot be taken into consideration. Should you have any questions about this position, please contact us at: talent.europe@rhimagnesita.com Agencies may only submit candidates for positions for which they have been invited to do so by the Head of Talent Acquisition Europe. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of RHI Magnesita and our company will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.  About RHI Magnesita We are the acknowledged technology leader in the refractory industry. Our company is defined by people. We are committed to diversity and know that multiple approaches, perspectives and backgrounds fuel creativity and innovation. It is our aspiration to build a workplace culture where everyone feels valued, engages, and can enjoy a truly inclusive environment and the diverse voices of our employees are heard. We foster a collaborative culture that cherishes ideas and determination to add value for our customers. Our leadership style encourages open-mindedness, reliability, pragmatism, and innovation. 7341415.title: Senior Consolidation & Controlling Specialist
7341415.description: Senior Consolidation & Controlling SpecialistOn-site, Hybrid Vienna, Austria Join us as Senior Consolidation & Controlling Specialist! Your Challenge & TasksConsolidation: Coordinate the preparation of the initial consolidated financial statements for the organization, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant accounting standards. Project Management: Manage the initial consolidation project for existing and new companies at Mavie from inception through completion, coordinating with various stakeholders and departments to ensure timely and efficient execution. Quarterly Consolidation and Controlling: Set up and implement a quarterly consolidation delivery process, focusing on best practices and automation to enhance efficiency and accuracy. Ensure that company performance KPIs are delivered with sound quality, based on reporting packages and internal performance measures. Management of Subsidiary Consolidation: Oversee the consolidation process for multiple subsidiaries, ensuring proper accounting practices and timely submission of financial data by our Finance experts in subsidiaries. Reporting & Controlling: Prepare consolidated financial statements. Manage the tracking and analysis of performance KPIs to ensure alignment with company goals providing insights and analysis to senior management and the shareholder company. Performance Management: Analyze performance metrics, identify areas for improvement, and collaborate with local teams to implement solutions that enhance efficiency and effectiveness. Regulatory Compliance and Standards: Ensure compliance with all relevant accounting and tax regulations and internal policies. Internal Controls: Establish and maintain effective internal controls related to the consolidation process, ensuring compliance with organizational policies and accounting standards. Collaboration: Work closely with external accounting and tax providers to ensure timely bookings, as well as with the Group Consolidation and Tax team to guarantee accurate reporting to the Group. What you need to be successful3-7 years of professional experience in Group Accounting or Consolidation, ideally in an international environment. Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and consolidation processes. Proficient in financial software and Microsoft Excel; experience with consolidation software (SAP) is a plus. Experience in working with multiple subsidiaries and knowledge of international accounting standards. A results-oriented mindset, with a track record of implementing performance management and controlling strategies to ensure budget adherence and optimize resource allocation. Excellent communication skills in English and German(written and verbal). Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment What you can expectLearning & development budget: An annual, individual learning and development budget of EUR 1,500 and German lessons (if needed). Workplace flexibility: Flexible working hours and the option of regularly working from home. Office food & snacks: A lunch menu at our office ("Schrankerl"), along with a selection of free fruit, snacks and drinks. Innovative office environment: A contemporary office environment that aligns with our innovative way of thinking and allows us to collaborate with our diverse team. Team events: Regular team events, "Thirsty Thursdays" and unforgettable offsite team experiences to strengthen our team spirit. Mental health support: The opportunity to engage in individual mental health counseling (EAP) through Mavie Work. Insurance discount: Discount on insurance products with our parent company UNIQA. Public transportation ticket: A subsidized ticket for public transportation that you can use in the whole of Austria. Due to legal requirements in Austria, we are obliged to state the minimum salary for this position. Our salary range for this position starts at 60.000 EUR. Based on your experience and qualifications, our final offer will be a competitive market value-based salary. About usMavie Next is a corporate start-up founded in 2020 by the UNIQA insurance group and has since then grown to a team of over 40 digital healthcare enthusiasts from over 20 countries. With an office in the heart of Vienna (but ambitions across Europe), our mission is to ideate, incubate, and scale B2B and B2C health and wellbeing solutions that empower people to lead healthier, more fulfilling lives. You can find out more about our solutions here. What it's like to work with us We empower our team members to take on responsibility, with no rigid role definitions and many possibilities for continuous on-the-job learning.   Our work is diverse, with an emphasis on innovation and real impact. You can really make a difference in healthcare. But you have to be aware that working here is more than just a "job" for most of us. It can be tough.   We are pushing our boundaries - as a team and individuals - and you should be able to manage your energy within a fast-paced, often high-expectations environment.   Our mission is extremely ambitious. If we achieve our high goals, this is going to significantly impact the quality of life of the generations to come and will be a great story to tell to your grandchildren.   Worried we're all work and no play? Fear not!  We're a bunch of passionate team players with diverse backgrounds who also like to have fun at work and forge personal connections. Take a closer look Apply
